Summary: Slow moving misty firey-orange fireball with startling details when seen through binoculars
divs: Sighting DetailsI had been doing my email, around 10 PM, and was quite centered on the computer at the time. I don't know why I looked up and turned around to face the window, but when I did I was stunned by the sight of a large fiery-looking object in the sky. It was about the size of a nickel held at arms length, and was approaching from the east. As I watched it it veered toward the north. The color was a striking flaming-orange and looked totally unusual and out of place, so I looked at it through my 7x35 binocular which was on the bookcase near the window. I was able to see that under magnification the object was a group of lights surrounded by a halo, or oval ring that had depth to it. To the naked eye the object appeared to be a rather fuzzy, flaming-orange-colored circular mass. It was traveling horizontally, just above a wispy cloud cover that was moving in. It was moving quite a bit faster than an airplane, but nowhere near fast enough to be considered a meteor of any sort. It did not appear to be falling. At one point I noticed a bright star-like object which was near the object but traveling in a direction away from it. It appeared to be at the same altitude. I think it may have been released out the back end of the fireball object, but I am not sure. The orange object faded from view as it entered a cloud bank which was moving into the northeast quadrant of the sky.
trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Keene
There were no other sightings in Keene on or around July 27th 2007
